programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: AJ Smith-Shawver made six appearances and five starts for the Braves last season, finishing with a 1-0 record and a 4.26 ERA; Nick Pivetta struck out 172 batters over 145.2 innings for the Padres last year.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: San Jose is 8-20-7 on the road this season but has won its last two meetings with the Kings, including a 7-2 victory at home on Nov. 25; Los Angeles is 5-0-2 in its last seven meetings with the Sharks at Crypto.com Arena.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: NCAA Championship In the Studio
programme.desc: Analyst and SportsCenter anchor Elle Duncan is joined by experts Rebecca Lobo and Andraya Carter as they discuss the upcoming action in the 2024 Women's NCAA Tournament with breakdowns of matchups and keys to the game with highlights and analysis.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UCLA, USC, defending champion South Carolina and Texas are the No. 1 seeds in their respective regional brackets, as 68 teams battle it out in the single-elimination tournament to crown a national champion in women's college basketball.

programme.desc: Doc Gooden and Darryl Strawberry were on top of the world when they led the New York Mets to a World Series in 1986, but their life choices took them down destructive paths riddled with addictions, tabloid punchlines, and ultimately, redemption.

programme.desc: On June 2, 2010, Detroit Tigers pitcher Armando Galarraga was one out away from the first perfect game in franchise history, but a wrong call by umpire Jim Joyce would spoil that opportunity and cause backlash on a worldwide scale.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The Los Angeles Dodgers and New York Yankees meet in the World Series in back-to-back years in 1977 and 1978, creating a cross-country rivalry featuring unique storylines throughout both dugouts and memorable moments in each series.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Utah (16-16) is one of five teams from the Big 12 competing in the inaugural tournament behind Gabe Madsen, who led the team with 15.1 ppg; Butler (14-19) is one of four teams from the Big East in the field behind Jahmyl Telfort and Pierre Brooks II.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: George Washington (21-12) makes its first postseason appearance since 2017; Boise State (24-10) fell to Colorado State in the Mountain West Tournament championship game, but is led by All-Mountain West First Team member Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: George Washington (21-12) makes its first postseason appearance since 2017; Boise State (24-10) fell to Colorado State in the Mountain West Tournament championship game, but is led by All-Mountain West First Team member Tyson Degenhart.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his first Cup Series win of the season with his victory at Homestead over Alex Bowman, while William Byron holds onto his points lead; William Byron averaged 76.096 mph en route to his win last year over Larson.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Nebraska (17-14) look to rebound following a five-game skid behind All-Big Ten First Team member Brice Williams; Arizona State (13-19) will look to put an end to its five-game losing streak, facing the Cornhuskers for the first time since 2008.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Georgetown (17-15) is one of four Big East representatives in the inaugural tournament, led by All-Big East First Team member Micah Peavy; Washington State (19-14) makes its second-straight postseason appearance, first under new coach David Riley.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: College Basketball Crown Extra Pregame
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming College Basketball Crown game, breaking down the key players to watch on both teams who could determine the outcome, the latest news and what the two teams will need to do in order to come away with a win.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: DeeRonn Booker of Albuquerque, N.M. captured his maiden PBA Tour title and became just the third African Ameran to win a major tournament with his victory in last year's edition held at Suncoast Bowling Center in Las Vegas.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez continued his strong start with a dominant victory at Argentina to increase his lead over his brother, Alex Marquez to 16 points; Maverick Vinales won the grand prix race last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Antron Brown in Top Fuel by 40 points, Paul Lee leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by two points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by seven points after Phoenix, the second event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Women's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.title: AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series
programme.desc: The top competitors from around the world compete in the AMSOIL Championship Snocross Series, the premier snowmobile racing event in North America, featuring racers competing on a track with big jumps, highlights of top moments and interviews.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Vegas claimed a 3-0 victory over San Diego in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 7, led by 16 kills and 3 blocks from Hannah Maddux; Alisha Glass Childress added 34 assists and 17 digs for the Thrill in the win away from home.

programme.desc: Vegas claimed a 3-0 victory over San Diego in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 7, led by 16 kills and 3 blocks from Hannah Maddux; Alisha Glass Childress added 34 assists and 17 digs for the Thrill in the win away from home.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his fourth Truck Series win of his career with his victory at Homestead over Layne Riggs; Christian Eckes won both races at Martinsville last year, defeating Ty Majeski by .644 seconds and Ben Rhodes by 1.191 seconds.
